title: Conditions (Overview)
excerpt: Many effects impose a condition, a temporary state that alters the recipient’s capabilities. The specific conditions, their durations, and stacking rules are detailed in sub-entries.

subEntries.title: Duration
subEntries.excerpt: A condition lasts either for a duration specified by the effect that imposed it or until it is countered.

subEntries.title: Conditions Don’t Stack
subEntries.excerpt: If multiple effects impose the same condition, the effects don’t get worse. The Exhaustion condition is an exception.

subEntries.title: Blinded
subEntries.excerpt: A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails ability checks requiring sight. Attack rolls against the creature have Advantage, and its attack rolls have Disadvantage.

subEntries.title: Charmed
subEntries.excerpt: A charmed creature can't attack the charmer, and the charmer has Advantage on social ability checks against the creature.

subEntries.title: Deafened
subEntries.excerpt: A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

subEntries.title: Exhaustion
subEntries.excerpt: Exhaustion is a cumulative condition with multiple levels. Each level imposes penalties to D20 tests and speed.

subEntries.title: Frightened
subEntries.excerpt: A frightened creature has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight, and it can't willingly move closer to the source.

subEntries.title: Grappled
subEntries.excerpt: A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it has Disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than the grappler.

subEntries.title: Incapacitated
subEntries.excerpt: An incapacitated creature can't take any action, Bonus Action, or Reaction, can't speak, and their Concentration is broken.

subEntries.title: Invisible
subEntries.excerpt: An invisible creature can't be seen without magic or special senses. Attack rolls against it have Disadvantage, and its attack rolls have Advantage.

subEntries.title: Paralyzed
subEntries.excerpt: A paralyzed creature is Incapacitated, can't move or speak, and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attacks against it have Advantage and are critical hits if the attacker is within 5 feet.

subEntries.title: Petrified
subEntries.excerpt: A petrified creature is transformed into a solid inanimate substance. It is Incapacitated, can't move or speak, has resistance to all damage, and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

subEntries.title: Poisoned
subEntries.excerpt: A poisoned creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

subEntries.title: Prone
subEntries.excerpt: A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl or stand up. It has Disadvantage on attack rolls, and attacks against it have Advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet, otherwise they have Disadvantage.

subEntries.title: Restrained
subEntries.excerpt: A restrained creature's speed becomes 0. Attack rolls against it have Advantage, its attack rolls have Disadvantage, and it has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

subEntries.title: Stunned
subEntries.excerpt: A stunned creature is Incapacitated, automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls against it have Advantage.

subEntries.title: Unconscious
subEntries.excerpt: An unconscious creature is Incapacitated, Prone, and unaware of its surroundings. It drops what it's holding and automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attacks against it have Advantage and are critical hits if the attacker is within 5 feet.
